fixtures.description: a list of strings, containing paths to database fixtures

comparisonParams.description: Boolean switches to conrol response checks

ignoreValues.description: Ignore response body JSON values, validate only parameters names

DisallowExtraFields.description: Disallow extra JSON parameters in response body

ignoreArraysOrdering.description: Ignore JSON arrays elements ordering in response body

ignoreDbOrdering.description: Toggles ignore ordering in DB response

anyOf.title: run only this specific test, and mark all other tests with unset status as skipped
do not run test, only mark it as broken
do not run test, skip it

beforeScript.description: script, that executes after mocks setup and before the HTTP-request is sent

path.description: string with a path to the script file.

timeout.description: time in seconds, until stopping the script on timeout. The default value is 3

afterRequestScript.description: script, that executes after the HTTP-request was sent

path.description: string with a path to the script file.

timeout.description: time in seconds, until stopping the script on timeout. The default value is 3

dbQuery.description: a string that contains an SQL query

dbResponse.description: a list of strings, containing JSON objects that the DB request should return

variables.description: map of strings that substituted in placeholders. example of placeholder: {{ $my_variable }}

request.description: string that contains HTTP request body

response.description: numeric HTTP response code (i.e. 200:) with desired response body

cases.description: a list of cases, containing parameters to substitute into variables

statusCode.description: HTTP-code of the response, the default value is 200

dbQueryArgs.description: map of database request parametrization arguments

dbResponseArgs.description: map of database response parametrization arguments

requestArgs.description: map of HTTP request parametrization arguments

responseArgs.description: numeric HTTP response code (i.e. 200:) with map of parametrization arguments

anyOf.title: Empty strategy. All requests are served with 204 No Content and empty body. No parameters.
Returns a response read from a file.
Returns a defined response.
This strategy gives ability to use incoming request data into mock response. Implemented with package text/template. Automatically preload incoming request into variable named request
Uses different response strategies, depending on a path of a requested resource.
Uses various response strategies, depending on the request method.
With this strategy for each consequent request you will get a reply defined by a consequent nested strategy.
The strategy that by default drops the connection on any request. Used to emulate the network problems.

calls.description: how many times each mock or mock resource must be called

filename.description: name of the file that contains the response body

body.description: sets the response body, must be valid text/template string

uris.description: a map of resources, each resource can be configured as a separate mock-service using any available request constraints and response strategies

basePath.description: common base route for all resources, empty by default

methods.description: a map of methods (GET, POST, etc), each method can be configured as a separate mock-service using any available request constraints and response strategies

anyOf.title: Empty constraint. Always successful. No parameters.

Checks that the request path corresponds to the expected one.

Checks that the request has the defined body text, or it falls under the definition of a regular expression.
